dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3984 IH: Expedited Removal Expansion Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Mace (for herself, Mr. Biggs of Arizona, Mr. Gill of Texas, Ms. Boebert, Mr. Gosar, and Mr. Steube) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend section 235 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to remove certain exceptions with respect to the inspection of applicants for admission.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expedited Removal Expansion Act of 2025.
Section 235(b)(1) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1225(b)(1)) is amended in—

clause.text: by striking (other than an alien described in subparagraph (F)); and
by striking under section 212(a)(6)(C) or 212(a)(7), and inserting under section 212;
by striking (other than an alien described in subparagraph (F)); and
by striking under section 212(a)(6)(C) or 212(a)(7) and inserting under section 212; and
by striking who is not described in subparagraph (F),; and

by striking , and who has not affirmatively shown, to the satisfaction of an immigration officer, that the alien has been physically present in the United States continuously for the 2-year period immediately prior to the date of the determination of inadmissibility under this subparagraph;
